author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Auckland’s Ambury Farm Day attracts over 30,000 people a dayTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Auckland’s Ambury Farm Day attracts over 30,000 people a day
Watch the sheep shearing, have a go at gumboot throwing and get up close and personal with some of the farmyard residents at Auckland Council’s Ambury Farm Day on 4 October.
The annual event at the council’s Ambury Regional Park is extremely popular and attracts over 30,000 people a day.
This is the 27th edition of the Ambury Farm Day.
Mixed with the farm-style fun will be live entertainment, a bouncy castle, great food and rides, wood chopping and if you cycle to the event, your ride will get a free tune-up.
Cr Christine Fletcher, chair of the Parks, Recreation and Sport Committee says, ““The mixture of fun, farming and education is a real hit, especially for those not often exposed to farm life.”
“Ambury Farm Day is a great day out for family and friends of all ages; bring a picnic lunch or enjoy the food on site,” senior ranger Wayne Carlson says.
